q: The room erupted in applause after one delegate at today's event quizzed Steve Ballmer on the fine print in MS licensing, which could trip up unwary users. Steve Ballmer says he has no plans to simplify licensing. Customers want simplification to reduce costs; our shareholders want simplification without price decreases. Someone may choose a processor based licence for SQL Server, while another may decide on a server-based client access licence. Both offer lower costs depending on how they are deployed. So Steve Ballmer intends to continue giving users
